Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
Camera class implementation [The position where all the rays are coming from (In order to avoid the opposite implementation in which the camera 'gathering' all the rays from the environment)]

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera​(Point3D pos, Vector vT, Vector vU)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      pos - the current position of the camera
      vT - the vector toward the view plane
      vU - the vector up (parallel to the view plane)

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public Point3D getPosition()
      get the position of the camera
      Returns:
      position value

    • getVUp

      public Vector getVUp()
      get the Vector up of the camera
      Returns:
      Vector up value

    • getVTo

      public Vector getVTo()
      get the Vector towards the view plane, of the camera
      Returns:
      Vector towards value

    • getVRight

      public Vector getVRight()
      get the Vector right of the camera
      Returns:
      Vector right value

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight)
      Main method to handle *single-ray* projection through view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - Total number columns
      nY - Total number rows
      j - Column of the given cell
      i - Row of the given cell
      screenDistance - Distance from camera to the view plane
      screenWidth - Width of the screen
      screenHeight - Height of the screen
      Returns:
      A ray from the camera to the center of the given cell

    • constructRaysThroughPixel

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRaysThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, int interX, int interY)
      Secondary method to handle *multiple-ray* projection through pixel in view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - Total number columns
      nY - Total number rows
      j - Column of the given cell
      i - Row of the given cell
      screenDistance - Distance from camera to the view plane
      screenWidth - Width of the screen
      screenHeight - Height of the screen
      interX - Total number of inner columns
      interY - Total number of inner rows
      Returns:
      List of all rays through the given pixel

    • constructRaysThroughPixelEdges

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructRaysThroughPixelEdges​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight)
      method to handle *4* projection through pixel, side-function for the adaptiveSuperSampling recursion method
      Parameters:
      nX - Total number columns
      nY - Total number rows
      j - Column of the given cell
      i - Row of the given cell
      screenDistance - Distance from camera to the view plane
      screenWidth - Width of the screen
      screenHeight - Height of the screen
      Returns:
      list of 4 rays to the wanted positions in the pixel
